Related to this issue: https://github.com/apache/hudi/issues/6967
You guys have tried with this?
thanks.

none works.

> i have tried both hudi/hive. none works.

ok, will try presto 0.274 today,  Thank you for your feedback
thanks!
sure, thanks!
@sknukala : is it not possible to fix the consumers to detech whether its sec or ms granularity before casting. bcoz, then you can never upgrade hudi to ms granularity and are essentially stuck.
cool
@xiarixiaoyao this is my debug snapshot. Table/Query detail is related to the issue I just mentioned
The failed test case for `TestHoodieLogFormat` has no relationship with this change, and i test it locally, would just merge it soon ~
@szknb : sorry, may I know how you got it resolved.
please give the comprehensive schema evolution a try. please raise a new issue if you need more assistance.
Closing this due to no activity. Feel free to open a new issue if you are having any more issues. we can def look into deeply.
@kasured : gentle ping.

https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/6821
closing the issue as the fix is already landed. 
feel free to raise a new issue if you are looking for further assistance.

> @szknb : sorry, may I know how you got it resolved.

The reason is that a customized hudi common jar is used in the Spark environment, and such a section of check logic is added to the hudi jar. :)
@njalan : gentle ping.
@minihippo : if you have screenshots and commands, feel free to update here and close out the issue.
@minihippo @XuQianJin-Stars : can we please follow up here.
@jiangjiguang : can you please respond. I might need more info so that we can reproduce on our end.
@fzong76 : gentle ping.
feel free to close if you got the issue resolved.

@jdiebold : gentle ping. 
if you got the issue resolved, feel free to close the issue.
Closing due to no activity.
@MikeTipico : gentle ping. if you can give us a reproducible script, would be great.
@vicuna96 : gentle ping.
@nleena123 : are you still looking for assistance.

@kartik18 : gentle ping. 
if you got your issue resolved, feel free to close it out.

> @shenshengli 感谢您的贡献。请添加一些 UT 也许你可以添加流代码，在 TestSpark3DDL​​ 的第 293 行之后
> 
> ```
>           // drop + rename + insert
>           spark.sql(s"alter table $tableName drop column col6")
>           spark.sql(s"alter table $tableName rename column col5 to col6")
>           spark.sql(
>             s"""
>                | insert into $tableName values
>                | (1,3,1,11,100001,'101.01',1001.0001,100009.0001,'aaaaaa','2021-12-25 12:01:01',true,'a01','2021-12-25'),
>                | (11,3,1,11,100001,'101.01',1001.0001,100011.0001,'aaaaaa','2021-12-25 12:01:01',true,'a01','2021-12-25'),
>                | (6,6,5,15,100005,'105.05',1005.0005,100007.0005,'aaaaaa','2021-12-26 12:05:05',false,'a05','2021-12-26')
>                |""".stripMargin)
>           checkAnswer(spark.sql(s"select col6 from $tableName where id = 1 or id = 6 or id = 11 order by id").collect())(
>             Seq("aaaaaa"),
>             Seq("aaaaaa"),
>             Seq("aaaaaa")
>           )
> ```

ok

yes, its a known limitation as of now, that if there are multiple versions of the same record in same batch, we leverage preCombine api and entire record will be chosen based on precombine value. 

But we recently added support for partial update record. 
https://github.com/apache/hudi/blob/master/hudi-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/common/model/PartialUpdateAvroPayload.java

this should assist in your case. 
Also, we have RFC-46 where we are introducing new merge API through which we are unifying preCombine method and combineAndGetUpdate method. 

Let us know if you are looking for any more assistance.
Feel free to open a new issue if you are run into any issue w/ the new partial update payload added.

@nsivabalan Sorry for the delay. Ever since we upgraded to 0.11.0 we have not seen this so far. Again the main root cause is the concurrency issue caused by using SimpleDateFormat. Not sure if 0.9.0 can be even used without a backport

key gen for spark and spark-sql are aligned now. Closing the issue since its fixed. 
Feel free to open a new issue if you are looking for further assistance. 
or re-open if your ask is different.
@pratyakshsharma @jasondavindev : can someone help me to understand the ask better.

thanks. 
closing the issue as we have a fix already.

```
dataFrame.writeStream
          .format("org.apache.hudi").options(hoodieConf)
          .outputMode(OutputMode.Append())
          .trigger(Trigger.ProcessingTime("10 seconds"))
          .start()
          .awaitTermination()
```

> 

hi @KnightChess can you add a isuse to fix this? Thanks.

@nsivabalan : the granularity of seconds just works fine for us. Having a config can help users control the timestamp format or if need be to adapt ms, we can plan this activity.

Currently, having a default to ms is blocking migration to hudi 12(as we need to update all consumers) and we are loosing all performance improvements implemented in recent hudi versions. with the config, upgrade would be seamless.

@danny0405  could you pls help review this pr, thanks
@hudi-bot run azure
@nsivabalan I do not know it,  may be you got the wrong guy ？

@fsilent 
we need add caffine jar to presto-bundle,  
add  <include>com.github.ben-manes.caffeine:caffeine</include> to  presto-bundle pom.xml
```
                <includes>

                  <include>org.apache.hudi:hudi-common</include>
                  <include>org.apache.hudi:hudi-hadoop-mr</include>
                  <include>org.apache.hudi:hudi-hbase2.4.x</include>
                  <include>com.fasterxml.jackson.datatype:jackson-datatype-jsr310</include>

                  <include>org.apache.parquet:parquet-avro</include>
                  <include>org.apache.avro:avro</include>
                  <include>com.github.ben-manes.caffeine:caffeine</include>
                  <include>org.codehaus.jackson:*</include>
```

> @xiarixiaoyao Thank you. When will the repaired official spark bundle jar be released?

expect 0.13.0
@alexeykudinkin Thanks for your advice. I updated the pr, review again when you are free.
@hudi-bot run azure

> @duanyongvictory caffine java should be in the presto do you have webchat, my webcat is 1037817390

thanks @xiarixiaoyao for you support.

Make these changes can be work:
ALTER TABLE p1011 SET TBLPROPERTIES ('parquet.column.index.access'='false');
added com.github.ben-manes.caffeine:caffeine in presto-bundle pom.xml

## CI report:

* 8e22b49fa093f5ba8dafdedc2da6384a7decb1b0 Azure: [SUCCESS](https://dev.azure.com/apache-hudi-ci-org/785b6ef4-2f42-4a89-8f0e-5f0d7039a0cc/_build/results?buildId=12558) 

<details>
<summary>Bot commands</summary>
  @hudi-bot supports the following commands:

 - `@hudi-bot run azure` re-run the last Azure build
</details>

I tested the PR in our project, it works fine as expected. For each clean we have the 3 states requested, inflight and completed, and the clean planner checks only the partitions that have been modified since `earliestCommitToRetain`.

Recently, we incremented `CLEAN_MAX_COMMITS` to 24 as @nsivabalan [proposed](https://github.com/apache/hudi/issues/6953#issuecomment-1283143573) in order to clean the tables every 24 hours (we have one commit per hour) and avoid listing S3 partitions in the tables with infrequently changed partitions, but the config doesn't work as expected, because after 24 commits, if the list of files to delete is empty, the cleaner will be executed at each next commit until delete something, because for the clean planner, the last clean was when the were some files to delete, and all the next clean operations are not considered because they write nothing to the timeline.

In brief, we need this patch ASAP, can you please add it to 0.13.0?
